issue.title: Set JPMS module name in manifest

repository.name: opentest4j
repository.description: Common Java exception classes to represent test failures. Maintained by the JUnit team.

issue.body:
Like described in https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/866 the artifact published by **opentest4j** should set the JPMS module name in its MANIFEST.MF file:

`opentest4j` -> `org.opentest4j`

body:
When you say...
> - `junit-platform-commons` ‚û°Ô∏è `org.junit.platform.console`

I'm assuming you mean:

- `junit-platform-commons` ‚û°Ô∏è `org.junit.platform.commons`

üòâ

3 module names do not match their super [package names](https://twitter.com/jodastephen/status/870888939091103744).

## junit-jupiter-migration-support

Automatic-Module-Name: `org.junit.jupiter.migration.support`
Contains classes in packages that start with: `org/junit/jupiter/migrationsupport/**/*`

- [ ] rename Automatic-Module-Name to `org.junit.jupiter.migrationsupport` without the dot before `support` 

## junit-platform-console

Automatic-Module-Name: `org.junit.platform.console`
Contains classes in packages that start with:  `org/junit/platform/joptsimple/**/*`

- [ ] move shaded `joptsimple` to `org.junit.platform.console.joptsimple` 

## junit-platform-console-standalone

Automatic-Module-Name: `org.junit.platform.console.standalone`
Contains classes in various packages - **none** in a package named `org.junit.platform.console.standalone`. This artifact is just an "all-in-one" or "uber" JAR that is not meant to be on the module-path. It _should_ only be used as a command line program, like `java -jar ...stanalone.jar <options>`. See http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#running-tests-console-launcher

- [ ] leave as-is?
- [ ] remove Automatic-Module-Name from JAR's manifest?

"all-in-one" or "uber" jar files should not have the MANIFEST.MF entry, as they are unsuitable for the module path.

Shaded jars do need to be under the main super-package. It may be worth using `org.junit.platform.console.shaded.joptsimple` to emphasise what has happened.

Thanks for the review!

- Rename sub-project directory from `junit-jupiter-migration-support` to `junit-jupiter-migrationsupport` or treat it as a special case in the integration test?
- Move shaded joptsimpel to `org.junit.platform.console.shaded.joptsimple`
- Remove `AutomaticModuleName` from standalone JAR an skip it when testing the module names.

issue.title: Cleanup module names

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ‚úÖ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

- Rename sub-project directory from `junit-jupiter-migration-support` to `junit-jupiter-migrationsupport` and treat it as a special case in the integration test.
- Move shaded joptsimpel to `org.junit.platform.console.shadow.joptsimple`
- Remove `AutomaticModuleName` from standalone JAR and skip it when testing the module names.

Addresses requested changes in #866 

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Contributor License Agreement.

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests)
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/meta/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass

issue.title: Add stable automatic module name

repository.name: opentest4j
repository.description: Common Java exception classes to represent test failures. Maintained by the JUnit team.

issue.body:
## Overview

Add the `Automatic-Module-Name` attribute to the manifest with stable value: `org.opentest4j`

See https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/866 for details.

Closes #36


---
I hereby agree to the terms of the Open Test Alliance Contributor License Agreement.

issue.title: Add JPMS module name definition in MANIFEST.MF

repository.name: spock
repository.description: The Enterprise-ready testing and specification framework.

issue.title: Add JPMS module description to manifest

repository.name: mockito-java8
repository.description: Mockito add-ons leveraging Java 8 and lambda expressions to make mocking even more compact

issue.body:
To allow people to require mockito-java8 module using the fixed module name.

Some [information](http://blog.joda.org/2017/04/java-9-modules-jpms-basics.html).

It would be good Mockito to do it also in Mockito itself.
